paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: BRCA positive (BRCA 2) mutations were present in 26% of patient overall and 42% in patients with a family history of breast or ovarian cancer.
BRCA positive (BRCA 2) mutations were present in 26% of patient overall and 42% in patients with a family history of breast or ovarian cancer.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 mutations are associated with higher gene methylation rates compared to other groups.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of breast or ovarian cancer.
variants.additional_notes: The most frequent pathological variant in BRCA2 was c.1813dup.
key_quotes: BRCA positive (BRCA 2) mutations were present in 26% of patient overall and 42% in patients with a family history of breast or ovarian cancer.
